alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 11 at 3:04PM CDT until April 11 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS THROUGH EARLY THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MOST OF SOUTH CENTRAL NEBRASKA AND NORTH CENTRAL KANSAS ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR ALL OF SOUTH CENTRAL NEBRASKA AND NORTH CENTRAL KANSAS... The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 1 PM to 8 PM CDT Wednesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * WINDS... For the rest of today, south 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. For Wednesday, south 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY... For the rest of today, As low as 10 to 15 percent. For Wednesday, as low as 15 to 25 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly. Use caution if engaging in activities that may result in a fire starting.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
